project.PROJECT_DESCRIPTION: An advanced AI-powered collaborative IDE with intelligent code suggestions, error monitoring, and developer productivity tools
project.PROJECT_VISION: MAIK-AI-CODING-APP aims to be the most advanced, reliable, and accessible AI-powered development environment that enhances developer productivity through intelligent assistance, comprehensive error monitoring, and collaborative tools.
project.PROJECT_BACKGROUND: The MAIK-AI-CODING-APP platform began as a way to democratize AI-assisted development, but encountered challenges with memory management, token optimization, and error handling that impacted user experience. The remediation project addresses these core issues to make the platform robust and enterprise-ready.
project.PROJECT_CHALLENGES: The current implementation suffers from monolithic architecture, inconsistent error handling, memory limitations, and lack of observability. These issues lead to context loss, hallucinations, crashes, and poor performance under load.
project.PROJECT_GOAL_1: Implement a modular, maintainable architecture with clearly defined interfaces
project.PROJECT_GOAL_2: Create a robust memory management system to prevent context loss and hallucinations
project.PROJECT_GOAL_3: Establish comprehensive error handling with proper monitoring and recovery paths
project.PROJECT_GOAL_4: Optimize LLM interactions for token efficiency and context window management
project.PROJECT_GOAL_5: Add governance and transparency features for responsible AI usage
project.SUCCESS_FACTOR_1: Reduced error rates and system crashes
project.SUCCESS_FACTOR_2: Improved conversation coherence and context retention
project.SUCCESS_FACTOR_3: Decreased token usage and improved response times
project.PROJECT_BUDGET_RESOURCES: Dedicated internal development team with AI expertise

architecture.SYSTEM_OVERVIEW: MAIK-AI-CODING-APP uses a modular architecture with clear interfaces between components. The system employs dependency injection for flexibility and testability, with a central Agent orchestrating interactions between specialized managers for state, memory, prompts, and tools.
architecture.SYSTEM_COMPONENTS: Agent, StateManager, MemoryManager, PromptManager, ToolExecutor, ErrorHandler, AIGovernance
architecture.NETWORK_DIAGRAM: Client <-> API Server <-> Agent System <-> LLM API
architecture.DATA_FLOW: User requests flow from the client to the API server, which passes them to the Agent. The Agent orchestrates state retrieval, memory access, prompt construction, LLM calls, and tool execution before returning responses.
architecture.API_ENDPOINTS: /api/query (main endpoint for user interactions), /api/command (for tool execution), /api/session (for session management)
architecture.DATABASE_SCHEMA: Primary tables include users, sessions, conversations, memories, and governance_logs
architecture.INFRASTRUCTURE: Node.js backend with TypeScript, deployed on Replit infrastructure

tech_stack.DATABASE_TYPE: PostgreSQL with vector extensions for semantic search
tech_stack.API_FRAMEWORK: REST with Express, WebSockets for real-time updates

development_workflow.BRANCHING_STRATEGY: GitHub Flow with feature branches and pull requests
development_workflow.PR_PROCESS: Pull requests require at least one review and passing tests
development_workflow.CODE_REVIEW_PROCESS: Code reviews focus on architecture adherence, error handling, and test coverage
development_workflow.TESTING_PROCESS: Unit tests for each component, integration tests for key workflows, end-to-end tests for critical paths
development_workflow.RELEASE_PROCESS: Staged releases through development, staging, and production environments
development_workflow.DEPLOYMENT_PROCESS: Automated deployments through Replit after successful test runs
development_workflow.LOCAL_SETUP: Clone repository, install dependencies, set environment variables, and run npm start
development_workflow.CONFIG_COMMAND: cp .env.example .env && nano .env  # Edit with your API keys

coding_standards.NAMING_CONVENTIONS: camelCase for variables and functions, PascalCase for classes and interfaces, ALL_CAPS for constants
coding_standards.CODE_ORGANIZATION: Modules grouped by functionality, interfaces defined in separate files, clear dependency injection
coding_standards.COMMENTING_STANDARDS: JSDoc for all public methods, inline comments for complex logic, README.md for each module
coding_standards.LINTING_TOOLS: ESLint with TypeScript and Prettier plugins
coding_standards.COMMON_PATTERNS: Repository pattern for data access, Strategy pattern for algorithm selection, Observer pattern for events

design_system.DESIGN_PHILOSOPHY: Clean, accessible interfaces that prioritize developer productivity and minimize cognitive load
design_system.BRAND_GUIDELINES: Modern, professional aesthetic with a focus on readability and usability
design_system.COMPONENT_LIBRARY: Shadcn UI components with custom MAIK-AI-CODING-APP theme
design_system.DESIGN_SYSTEM_OVERVIEW: The MAIK-AI-CODING-APP Design System provides a unified visual language and component library for creating consistent, accessible, and performant interfaces across the platform. It prioritizes developer experience, readability, and productivity while maintaining a professional aesthetic.
design_system.BRAND_VOICE: Professional, concise, and helpful. Communications should empower developers by being clear, informative, and respectful of their time and expertise.
design_system.PRIMARY_LOGO_USAGE: The primary logo should be used in the header/navigation of applications and on official communications. Always use the SVG version for digital applications.
design_system.SECONDARY_LOGO_USAGE: The monochrome version can be used in situations where the full-color logo would be visually distracting or when space is limited.
design_system.LOGO_MIN_SIZE: The logo should not be displayed smaller than 24px in height to maintain legibility.
design_system.LOGO_CLEAR_SPACE: Maintain a clear space around the logo equal to the height of the 'M' in the logo.
design_system.LOGO_DO: Use the logo on appropriate backgrounds with sufficient contrast, maintain aspect ratio, use the SVG version when possible.
design_system.LOGO_DONT: Stretch or distort the logo, change the colors, rotate the logo, or place it on busy backgrounds that reduce visibility.
design_system.PRIMARY_COLOR_1_USAGE: Primary actions, key UI elements, header backgrounds
design_system.PRIMARY_COLOR_2_USAGE: Secondary actions, hover states for primary elements
design_system.PRIMARY_COLOR_3_USAGE: Highlights, focus states, secondary UI elements
design_system.SUCCESS_COLOR_USAGE: Success messages, completion indicators, positive actions
design_system.WARNING_COLOR_USAGE: Warning messages, alerts requiring attention but not critical
design_system.ERROR_COLOR_USAGE: Error messages, destructive actions, critical alerts
design_system.INFO_COLOR_USAGE: Informational messages, neutral alerts, general notifications
design_system.NEUTRAL_COLOR_1_USAGE: Background for light mode, text for dark mode
design_system.NEUTRAL_COLOR_2_USAGE: Subtle backgrounds, hover states in light mode
design_system.NEUTRAL_COLOR_3_USAGE: Text in light mode, UI elements in dark mode
design_system.NEUTRAL_COLOR_4_USAGE: Background for dark mode, text for light mode
design_system.PRIMARY_FONT: Inter, a versatile sans-serif typeface optimized for screen readability
design_system.SECONDARY_FONT: SF Pro Display, used for headings and emphasized UI elements
design_system.CODE_FONT: Jetbrains Mono, a monospaced font designed for code with ligature support
design_system.TYPE_SCALE_4_USAGE: Body text, main content, UI elements
design_system.TEXT_STYLE_1_DESC: Used for displaying code samples and snippets
design_system.TEXT_STYLE_1_CSS: font-family: 'Jetbrains Mono', monospace; font-size: 14px; line-height: 1.5; background-color: #f9fafb; padding: 1rem; border-radius: 0.375rem;
design_system.TEXT_STYLE_2_DESC: Used for code references within normal text
design_system.TEXT_STYLE_2_CSS: font-family: 'Jetbrains Mono', monospace; font-size: 0.875em; background-color: #f9fafb; padding: 0.2em 0.4em; border-radius: 0.25rem;
design_system.TEXT_STYLE_3_DESC: Used for error notifications and alerts
design_system.SPACING_1_USAGE: Minimal spacing, tight UI elements, icon padding
design_system.SPACING_5_USAGE: Major section breaks, large component spacing
design_system.SPACING_6_USAGE: Page section spacing, major layout divisions
design_system.GRID_SYSTEM_DESCRIPTION: MAIK-AI-CODING-APP uses a 12-column responsive grid system with adjustable gutters based on viewport size. The grid adapts to different screen sizes through our breakpoint system.
design_system.BREAKPOINT_2_DESC: Medium devices, landscape phones, small tablets
design_system.BREAKPOINT_4_DESC: Extra large devices, desktops, large laptops
design_system.BUTTON_1_USAGE: Main actions, form submissions, key user flows
design_system.BUTTON_3_USAGE: Minor actions, inline options, compact UI areas
design_system.FORM_1_USAGE: Single-line text entry, basic information collection
design_system.ICON_SYSTEM_DESCRIPTION: MAIK-AI-CODING-APP uses Lucide React icons for consistent UI elements, with customizable size, color, and weight attributes.
design_system.ICON_GUIDELINE_1: Keep icon sizes consistent with the surrounding UI elements
design_system.ICON_GUIDELINE_2: Use icons to enhance meaning, not replace text for critical actions
design_system.ICON_GUIDELINE_3: Maintain proper color contrast for accessibility when using icons
design_system.ILLUSTRATION_STYLE_DESCRIPTION: Clean, minimal illustrations with a focus on clarity and relevance to developer workflows. Illustrations should use the brand color palette and maintain a consistent weight and style.
design_system.ANIMATION_PRINCIPLE_1: Be purposeful - animations should serve a function, not distract
design_system.ANIMATION_PRINCIPLE_2: Be responsive - animations should feel instantaneous and enhance the sense of direct manipulation
design_system.ANIMATION_PRINCIPLE_3: Be subtle - animations should feel natural and not call attention to themselves

accessibility.ACCESSIBILITY_OVERVIEW: MAIK-AI-CODING-APP is committed to providing an accessible development environment for all users, including those with disabilities. Our accessibility standards ensure that all developers, regardless of ability, can utilize the full power of our AI-assisted coding platform.
accessibility.SPECIFIC_REQUIREMENTS: Support for screen readers, keyboard navigation, and high-contrast mode
accessibility.LEGAL_CONSIDERATIONS: Compliance with ADA requirements and international accessibility standards
accessibility.ACCESSIBILITY_FEATURES: Keyboard shortcuts, screen reader support, customizable UI elements
accessibility.SCREEN_READER_SUPPORT: ARIA attributes, semantic HTML, and screen reader testing
accessibility.KEYBOARD_NAVIGATION: Full keyboard navigation with intuitive shortcuts
accessibility.COLOR_CONTRAST: Minimum 4.5:1 contrast ratio for text, 3:1 for large text and UI components
accessibility.ACCESSIBILITY_TESTING: Automated testing with axe-core and manual testing with screen readers
